attributes.action: Issue all Security and Door Supervisors with Handcuffs, Batons and PAVA spray.
attributes.additional_details: To that end, I am calling for all Door Supervisors and Security Officers to be routinely issued with handcuffs, side-handled batons and PAVA spray. Training, for the former, already exists. However, Door Staff are not allowed to carry or use batons and PAVA spray; yet their issue could drastically reduce the number of violent assaults, in all front line security operations and in particular, those against Door Supervisors and Security Officers.
attributes.background: With the increase in the number of assaults against Door Supervisors and Security Officers (including several which have resulted in death); I believe that all Door Supervisors and Security Officers should be allowed to protect themselves, their colleagues and the customers in their charge.

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for privately employed security or door supervisors. Issuing equipment would be the responsibility of individual employers, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We could accept a petition calling for a change in the law to allow security staff to carry batons and PAVA spray, if that is something you would like to happen.
